restaurants.name: Martha's Grill
restaurants.hours: Mon-Sat 5:00am-2:00pm, plus on Thu and Fri they stay open 5:00am-8:00pm. Closed Sunday.
restaurants.notes: Old service station. Love it, especially for breakfast. Right off the end of the runway, short walk from FBO.

restaurants.name: Sherry's Family Restaurant
restaurants.notes: Serves breakfast all day!

airport.name: Stanton's BBQ and Fish Camp Fly-In Restaurant

restaurants.name: Stanton’s BBQ and Fish Camp Fly-In Restaurant
restaurants.hours: Open Thu and Fri 11a-2p and 5p-830p, Sat 11a-830p, Sun 11a-230p. Closed Mon-Wed
restaurants.notes: 2300 foot runway (with a dogleg in the middle) Grass strip near Bennettsville SC. Walk from your airplane across the rural highway to the restaurant. Not on sectional (34.73N 79.67W) , need to be current on your short field flying and you cannot take an Aerowood airplane to a grass field without approval from an Aerowood CFI (which you get by taking them there and buying them lunch).

restaurants.name: Flying Pig BBQ
restaurants.notes: [Closed?] Walk down the ramp toward the runway to the path through the grass to the cemetery, open lock (code is SOCK) and walk thru cemetery and cross road to restaurant

restaurants.name: Pik-n-Pig
restaurants.notes: 2500’ paved strip with interesting approaches. Park on the grass right in front of the restaurant.

airport.name: Jim Hamilton L B Owens Airport

restaurants.name: Hunter-Gatherer Brewery & Ale House
restaurants.notes: Hunter-Gatherer Brewery & Ale House is on the NE end of the field in the historic Curtiss-Wright Hangar. Walking distance from FBO

restaurants.name: Beacon Drive In
restaurants.address: 255 John B. White, Sr. Boulevard, Spartanburg, SC 29306
restaurants.hours: TUESDAY - THURSDAY:  7:30AM - 9:00PM, FRIDAY & SATURDAY:  7:30AM - 10:00PM, CLOSED CHRISTMAS DAY, THANKSGIVING DAY, EASTER, MOTHER'S DAY
restaurants.notes: 5 minute drive (courtesy car or Uber) the Beacon Drive-in. Serving since 1946!

restaurants.name: Crosswind Cafe
restaurants.notes: Park on the “restaurant ramp” right in front of the restaurant. Also has Hickory Aviation Museum, open Tue-Fri 10a-3p, Sat 10a-5p, Sun 1p-5p.

restaurants.name: Runway Cafe
restaurants.address: 21 Airport Road Extension, Greenville, South Carolina 29607
restaurants.notes: Tie down on the “restaurant ramp” right in front of the restaurant. Includes playground for kids and a 20% discount for pilots.

restaurants.name: White Duck Taco Shop
restaurants.notes: 0.3 mile walk from the ramp. Dining room and expansive outdoor seating.

restaurants.name: Simply Suzanne's Cafe
restaurants.notes: Tie down on the “restaurant ramp” right in front of the restaurant. Best burger around and great mountain views without really getting in the middle of the hills!

restaurants.name: Joe's Barbecue Kitchen
restaurants.notes: Usually lowest priced 100LL in NC. Get a courtesy car and drive 3.1 mi to Joe’s Barbecue.

airport.name: Raleigh Regional at Person County Airport

restaurants.name: The Homestead Steakhouse
restaurants.hours: Open Tue-Thu 5p-9p, Fri 5p-930p, Sun 1130a-830p, closed Monday.
restaurants.notes: Reliable sources (even though they are pilots) tell me that you can get a ride for the 1.4 mi to the Homestead Steakhouse and Restaurant.

restaurants.name: Fleet Landing Restaurant & Bar
restaurants.hours: Open 11a-330p 7 days/week, also Sun-Thu 5p-10p, Fri-Sat 5p-11p, Brunch Sat and Sun 11a-3p
restaurants.notes: Charleston is a nice place to visit but airports aren't that close to town. Love landing at CHS or LRO, getting a courtesy or rental car and going downtown to wander around and eat overlooking the water at Fleet Landing. There are lots of seafood restaurants at Shem Creek, which is only 12 miles from LRO.

restaurants.name: Milanos Oxford
restaurants.notes: Fly in, get the courtesy car, and drive 5.2 mi to Main Street in Oxford NC to eat Italian at Milano’s. Well worth the short drive!

restaurants.name: Ernie's Restaurant
restaurants.address: 1010 John Randolph Blvd, South Boston, VA 24592
restaurants.notes: Call Ernies Restaurant and they will come pick you up at the airport.

restaurants.name: Provision Company
restaurants.hours: Open Lunch and Dinner 7 days/week. BUT closed Nov-March
restaurants.notes: Good seafood restaurants nearby, my favorite is the Provision Company. Very near is Fishy Fishy Café , both are on the water. They stay open later into the winter AND they have a webcam so you can see what the weather is before you go! You can rent a car through the FBO - though if you just want seafood for lunch you might be able to get the crew car. BONUS – beside Fishy Fishy is Potter’s Seafood, so pack a cooler and buy fresh fish caught on the NC coast and unloaded from the boat at the adjacent dock.

restaurants.name: Fishy Fishy Cafe
restaurants.hours: Sunday-Thursday 11 AM - 8:00 PM. Friday-Saturday 11 AM - 9:00 PM

restaurants.name: The Hen & the Hog
restaurants.hours: Tue & Wed 11a-3p, Thu & Fri 11a-3p, then 6p-10p, Sat 6p-10p
restaurants.notes: The Hen and The Hog is 3.3 miles from IXA, a short drive in the FBO’s Crown Vic (former Police cruiser) courtesy car.

restaurants.name: The Flying Machine
restaurants.notes: Located on the south end of the field.

restaurants.name: Roland's BBQ
restaurants.hours: Tuesday-Thursday 11:00 AM - 7:00 PM. Friday-Saturday 11:00 AM - 8:00 PM. Closed Sunday-Monday.
restaurants.notes: Roland’s BBQ is 1.2 mi from MRH. Hole-in-the wall place with great BBQ. Courtesy car available.

restaurants.name: Southern Soul Barbeque
restaurants.address: 2020 Demere Road St. Simons Island, GA 31522
restaurants.notes: Get the courtesy car and drive (or you can walk if it’s a nice day, only 0.3 mile) to Southern Soul BBQ, featured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives.

restaurants.name: Outer Banks Brewing Station
restaurants.address: 600 S Croatan Hwy, Kill Devil Hills, NC 27948
restaurants.notes: Birthplace of aviation – where the Wright Brothers flew on Dec 17, 1903. Every pilot has to make the pilgrimage here. Land (3000’ paved strip, be good at crosswinds), walk over to the Wright Brothers Memorial, then less than a mile walk to Outer Banks Brewing Company. From EQY, fly to TYI then between the restricted areas to FFA. If you need fuel, MQI is 6 miles across the water from FFA. Then you can fly VFR down the coast, just offshore from the Outer Banks, drop in at HSE (Billy Mitchell field at Frisco/Cape Hatteras) and W95 (Ocracoke) and land at MRH. Return inland from there – or you can continue to follow the coast south but you’ll have to go offshore to avoid Restricted areas
